headline: Blueberry Pound Cake
description: This rich blueberry pound cake is easy to make in a Bundt pan with fresh juicy berries. Enjoy a slice for breakfast or Ã  la mode for dessert.
name: Blueberry Pound Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 10-inch fluted tube pan (such as Bundt) with 2 tablespoons softened butter. Sprinkle 1/4 cup sugar into the pan and tilt gently to coat.
Mix 2 3/4 cups flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl. Toss blueberries and remaining 1/4 cup flour together in another bowl until coated.

Cream remaining 2 cups sugar and 1 cup butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Gradually beat in flour mixture, then fold in floured blueberries. Pour batter into the prepared pan.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, 70 to 80 minutes. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely.

review.reviewBody: This is the first time for me to try this recipe and I wonâ€™t use it again. #1 It didnâ€™t rise like my other bundt cakes, and #2 I followed the directions completely and the blueberries stuck to the bottom of my cake. I coated them with so much flour that I thought i was using too much flour. I folded them in like the directions says. This was a big disappointment!
This is my go to recipe, I make this pound cake at least 6 times a year. Occasionally I use raspberries instead of blueberries. My family loves it 5 Stars from this family!

I have made this simple, lovely, poundcake more than three dozen times. It is always delicious, always appreciated, and you need very little planning as most of the ingredients one has around the house. I sprinkle my extra sugar on the top, rather than as directed on the bottom,after filling the Bundt pan. The first time I ever made it I incorrectly did that and it give us a real chewy meringue type finish to the bottom which we enjoy. Highly recommend this.
Flavor was just okay. And the sugar caused a fair amount of the cake to stick in the pan.
Wouldn't change a thing... easy to prepare. True bake time. Delicious

We have 9 blueberry bushes so I'm always looking for good recipes and this one hit the mark. 1st made a bundt cake and everyone loved it. Next time I made it in the medium size loaf pans and that was great just as gifts. This is a thick batter and I went from using a hand mixer to a stand mixer and it went a lot faster. One thing I added was in the loaf pans I sprinkled turbinado sugar on top...adds a nice crunch!

The batter was very thick. The cake came out perfectly moist. I baked for 70 minutes at 325F. This cake was a huge crowd pleaser. I doubled the blueberries because I had just picked them fresh. See my photo.
I added some whipped cream cheese about 3 the I had left over made the batter a bit creamer. Followed the recipe otherwise it was delicious.
I like the recipe. It was easy to make. I didnâ€™t make any changes at all. Of course I havenâ€™t tasted it yet. Itâ€™s still in the oven! ðŸ˜¯
In addition, I add the grated rind of one lemon. Then after the cake has cooled I mix the juice of the lemon with confectioner's sugar and drizzle over top. Delicious! Great recipe and easy to make!
2nd time making it just as the recipe calls for. Excellent with fresh blueberries.
Totally awesome would change a thing. Best Blueberry bunt cake ever.

Love this easy, moist and delicious pound cake. I did not sprinkle the 1/4 cup of sugar into the pan, and it was still amazing. I thought the 2 cups of sugar would be enough, and I was correct. other than the extra sugar, I followed recipe exactly. The baking time was a solid 80 min. I stopped originally at 60, checked at 70 and then 80 minutes. 80 min @ 325 was perfect! Thanks for a great recipe!!

I followed directions exactly and this cake is amazing. The batter supposed to be think. Everyone raved about it. Delicious. Next time Iâ€™ll spray more Pam as it stuck on one side. Need to let it cool for quite awhile. So good!
Amazing!!!! Added to cake- 1/2 cup sour cream and 1 tsp almond extract. For glaze- powdered sugar, blueberries and lemon juice.
So delicious! I was concerned when the batter was so thick, but it baked up perfectly! Will definitely be making this again.
I thought it was delicious! Thank you for sharing the recipe.

This was delicious! Followed the recipe as stated and read the reviews. Adding sour cream would make it more moist but then it wouldnâ€™t be pound cake which is supposed to be dense. With or without itâ€™s a great recipe.

I have make this recipe dozens of times after my sister introduced me to it. It is always a favorite to bring to work or family events. I recently sub 1 1/2 tsp of lemon extract for the vanilla to make a lemon blueberry cake and it was AMAZING. Such an easy but delicious recipe!!!

Turned out perfectly! I followed some suggestions to add a little liquidâ€”some lemon juice and some milkâ€”for a smoother batter. Added zest of one lemon to the dry ingredients. Baked for 76 minutes. After 10 cooling, the cake released perfectly onto the serving plate. Hereâ€™s what made the biggest impact for success: I put a small layer of plain batter in the bottom of the Bundt pan before adding the blueberries to the remaining batter. No burnt blueberries and an even distribution of berries. Iâ€™ll make this one again for sure!
Made recipe with frozen blueberries, defrosting them before they were added to batter. Found the cake to be far too sweet & dense. Needed more blueberries, less sugar.

Iâ€™ve made this twice now, the first time I used the recipe as written, I did the butter/sugar for the pan, but it stuck really bad, however, it tasted amazing! The second round last night I used spray nonstick, and no sugar for the bundt pan, came right out no problem, I also added lemon extract with the vanilla. I then made an orange zest glaze using the juice and zest of one clementine (I didnâ€™t have a lemon on hand) powdered sugar and milk. It lasted one night! This basic recipe is awesome as is, but the variety of things you can do to change it up are endless!
Great recipe. Easy to make and it tastes fantastic! I used frozen blubes but left them at room temp for about 20 min.

This was the Perfect Pound Cake...moist and delicious! I added a bit of lemon zest and a splash of lemon juice just because I like that extra zip. Next, I will try dried apricot and walnuts instead of blueberry. I shared with my neighbors [pandemic cooking] and they all raved. This is a definite keeper!
This cake was unbelievably moist and now a family favorite. If I am not making blueberry buckle, this is my favorite blueberry desert.
I substituted mulberries (from my freezer) for the blueberries and added about 1/2 cup of raspberries and one medium diced apple. DELISH!!!
absolutely loved this recipe !
Easy excellent recipe. the flavor is spot on. Thank you.
i did sprinkle the sugar to line the pan, i was afraid it would burn but it did not. this cake is yummy. i followed directions exactly. will make again but it definitely needs more blueberries
Delicious. The batter was quite thick, so I added another egg. Came out great.

This was the best tasting pound cake I have ever made, BUT it stuck to the pan and fell to pieces. I'll try this one more time before giving up, only this time I'll use Bakers Secret and omit the sugar. Much better the second day, so bake ahead.
Definitely going to make this again. We live surrounded by blueberry fields, so we have many great recipes. This is now my new favorite! Going to make this every blueberry season from now on.
The only change I made was to use 3/4 cup wheat flour & the rest all purpose. I had recently returned home from Michigan with 5# of fresh blueberries & this was a great way to use them!
I wouldn't change a thing. My family devoured this. :)

I lessened the amount of sugar by a small amount and I forgot to put in the vanilla. Still came out fantastic. It was moist, substantial without being dense, sweet without being overwhelming. I got compliments on this one.
I used two loaf pans and added the butter sugar mixture on top before baking. Wonderful!
Cooked at 325 in convection oven for 57 minutes
Loved it! I did not coat the pan with sugar. Unncessary. Also, I used an 8x8 pan. Excellent recipe!
Wonderful! Except I used raspberries.. big hit !!! And I cooked in 9x13 pan @325 degrees for exactly 55 min.... fabulous....

YUM! I followed the recipe exactly but added strawberries and raspberries to make it a triple berry pound cake. Definitely recommend coating the bottom of the pan with butter and sugar. I thought it was odd, but it gives it a sweet crunch. Also, the batter will be very thick but donâ€™t let that worry you. It bakes perfectly and makes a dense but moist cake. I will definitely make it again!!
Stuck in the pan. Had to scrape it out. Complete disaster. Cake was good......but it looked terrible. I followed directions but still did not work. Only bundt cake I have ever had stick like this
Followed the recipe with a few changes. I added an extra tsp. Of vanilla extract, and half cup of lemon flavored olive oil to make it a lemon-blueberry pound cake. Super yummy!!!
Easy recipe and everyone loved it.
The bread itself was delicious. But mine got stuck to the pan not sure what I did wrong. I followed the recipe to the t
Great taste and texture. I made with 3 cups of blueberries and used 2/3 cup of oat flour from (simply ground Oats in a blender until it looks like flour.

Delicious. I will make it again. Went exactly by directions. Only thing I would do differently is put some batter in bottom of pan and where blueberries were at the bottom wanted to stick. It is really good. Not overly sweet just the right amount of sweet

So, I made it. It was a good recipe, but I did add a cup of sour cream and lemon juice and extract. That said, all of my blueberries sank to the bottom, which may have been due to my additions. But, it still was very good!

I made it exactly like it called for. And like others mine was really thick almost like a biscuit or leaning towards cookie dough I would waste the ingredients again unless someone can tell me where I went wrong Now I live in Colorado and always have to consider high altitude but couldnâ€™t think what to add the recipe called for plenty of flour
Everybody loved it !! I followed the recipe, except I added a 1/2 cup of strawberries also. Very delicious.

I am not good baker, but this cake comes out great every time I make it! Everyone loves it, and it is very simple to make. If you are not a baker like me, this is a tip I can offer: Soften the 2 Tablespoons of butter in a tiny bowl and use a brush to spread the butter in the pan. I've used fresh blueberries and frozen ones. Both are great!
I added a blueberry glaze because I made it into a birthday cake but it is delicious without! My husband and I love it and will make it again and he suggested to make muffins next time. Yum!

I had a freezer full of blueberries my brother and his girlfriend picked this past summer (46.7 lbs). I needed to use some and based on the star rating and reviews, choose this recipe and glad I did! Everyone that has tasted it, said it was fantastic. I did tweak according to reviewers and added half a cup of milk before folding in the blueberries, resulting in a moist, buttery and blueberry cake that I will be making again and again! I might even try some other tweaks with the lemon glaze or adding lemon zest and a little juice to the batter.
I made this cake tonight and it is the best pound cake the family has ever tasted. Will definitely make it again

Brought it to work and came back with an empty container. I used nonstick spray but will try the butter-sugar suggestion next time. Thanks for sharing the recipe!

Second time round I used cranberries Iâ€™d picked and frozen last Fall. So good even my 5yr old nephew had a big piece. Not one slice left.
I have made this many times, and it never ceases to have amazing flavor! I love it.
Delicious!!

My husbands favorite now.
It comes out of the pan quick and easy.
I would recommend this to even a novice baker
Omg. This is 5 on the Yumminess scale
Very good. Moist

This is a delicious pound cake which has been thoroughly enjoyed by everyone who I serve it to! (I've made it 2 or 3 times now since it is blueberry season) The sugar crunch on the crust adds a nice texture. This is a very sweet cake and next time I probably will cut back on the sugar in the recipe by about a half a cup.
Delicious, so moist and just perfect with coffee or tea. Something I will make for company.
Yes I will make again
I made it excatly as the recipe told me to. The only thing good about it was the blueberries. It took forever to make and when they call it a pound cake, I would call it a 2 pound cake
This recipe is a staple in our house during the end of July and August when blueberries are in season!

Loved it! Made it with fresh blueberries picked the day before. I was nervous about adding the sugar to the bottom of the pan, fearing it would burn, but it didn't. The batter was very thick, but I think that helped hold the blueberries in place so they didn't sink to the bottom. The cake was moist, not dry at all. I will definitely use this recipe again.
I made it and did not make any changes.
Yummy! I made this as directed except with gluten free flour (I believe it was rice flour).

This cake was a huge success! I made the batter but added about 3-4 heaping teaspoons of sour cream! I also made a lemon juice and sugar glaze on top while it was still warm, about 1/4 cup. The result was a slightly sticky lemony delight. I could eat that every Sunday! Everyone loved it!

This recipe turned out perfectly. I would not change anything! The batter does appear to be thick when you put it in the pan, but it cooks up like it should and is very moist. Take the extra step of buttering and sprinkling the pan with sugar. It adds a delightful crunchy feel to the outside.

This one's a keeper!
I didn't make it so the blueberries didn't stain the cake.I made it for my mom for mothers day. I sure will make it again!
This was amazing, I will make this again my family loved it! Best fruit pound cake Iâ€™ve ever eaten !!

Do yourself a favor and make this cake! It's absolutely delicious. I did add the zest of one lemon, which I think elevated the cake to new heights. Make sure to liberally butter the pan, and do sprinkle it with sugar because it makes a nice crust on the cake.
7/4/19--Won a first place and Reserve Champion at the Salem VA Fair. This one was without the lemon.
Cake came out perfect. People ate the entire cake and wanted seconds. I whipped up a cream cheese blueberry icing that gave it the over the top!
Made it two days ago, Everybody RAVED about it. Love this recipe.
Just made this: added zest of 1 lemon, 1 cup sour cream and used half whole wheat flour. Made a lemon glaze once cooled. Excellent!

I made this all summer with fresh blueberries and it turned out beautifully every time. Today I made it and added the zest and juice of one orange and one 12 oz bag of cranberries. It turned out wonderfully!!! My favorite recipe!!
This is by far the best blueberry cake I have ever made. This is my "go to" dessert to bring to any function or holiday. Everyone loves it. Thanks for sharing!
Makes a great hospitality bread for church. The bundt shape means slicing a few at a time -- leftover cake stays fresh.

Made this exactly according to the recipe. Have made it four times in the last month. It is truly delicious and beautiful. Always gets rave reviews and requests for me to make it again. Most times I put a lemon glaze on it. Thanks for the recipe.

Delicious cake, only problem was it stuck to the pan. I did exactly what was said in the recipe...2 tablespoons of butter and then sprinkled sugar. I even spread some batter in the bottom of my bundt pan first and then added the blueberries to the rest of the batter and then added that. I will try a different pan the next time I make this delicious pound cake.
Great recipe! Made a gluten free version. Used fresh blueberries and did add probably 1/4 or so if buttermilk. So yummy!!

This was easy and delicious...made according to the recipe except used 2 full pints of fresh blueberries. Other reader had said they would add more than the 2 cups and since my family really loves blueberries I added all of them. Turned out great.
Excellent, family favorite

Excellent recipe and I 2 tablespoons of added lemon juice + 1 tablespoon lemon zest to turn it to lemon blueberry cake

I added 1 tsp of baking powder because I felt that 1 tsp is not enough 

For topping:
Philadelphia cheese+ milk in the blinder
Butter+ powder sugar+ lemon zest +lemon juice
Add them to the cheese mix in the blinder and drizzle

Delicious! I made it as the recipe recommends except using frozen blueberries instead of fresh. I love the extra crisp and crunch that the sugar and butter in the pan make. (I didnâ€™t shake out the extra sugar after coating the pan.) I smashed a bag of thawed frozen strawberries then added fresh sliced strawberries and served with fresh whipped cream. It was beautiful and delicious. Great for 4th of July.

Wonderful! After years of making different cakes for my husband, this is only the second one heâ€™s gone back for seconds and thirds! Heâ€™s obsessed! Itâ€™s much lighter than a cream cheese or sour cream pound cake. I made it for 4th of July and used our farm fresh blueberries that we picked and froze earlier this season. I also added a simple lime juice+lime zest+ powdered sugar glaze on top. PERFECT! Thank you!
I added the zest of one lemon to the batter and made a lemon glaze to top it. Rave Reviews, even from my husband who is not a sweet eater!
I made this cake no changes and have made it 3 times now. It was delicious, not overly sweet which suits us. It would be great with whipped cream and/or ice cream if you are so inclined.
So good!! I topped with sugar. This was my first time making this and itâ€™s a hit!!!
I made this cake, it was super easy, super easy to make and super tasty!
I made this cake, it was super easy, super easy to make and super tasty!
This is an excellent pound cake!!! Was concerned that the batter was thick for a pound cake...and had never prepped a pan with sugar but all was good !!! Highly recommend this recipe.
I didnâ€™t make the sugar crust. Just added a bit of fresh lemon to the batter. And the milk glaze I made for the top. This is a great recipe! Moist and flavorful. Itâ€™s a must try !
This pound cake is FANTASTIC!! The butter and sugar in the pan makes for the most amazing crust! Will definitely be making this one again!!
Turned out great! I used one cup fresh blueberries and one cup frozen cherries. I didnâ€™t have a bundt pan so I used a regular 9x12 cake pan and baked for 50 mins. Was delicious!

I can't say enough about this recipe. The only change I made was adding a little lemon extract. The cake is moist, perfectly sweet and I love the slightly crunchy "crust" that formed on it. Delicious with sliced, sweetened, fresh strawberries spooned over the top!I will definitely make it again!

I had a bunch of extra blueberries in the house and company coming for dinner. Looked for a dessert recipe to make with the ingredients I had on hand. I came across this and read the reviews. It was super easy to make and like many reviews said despite a thick batter and fear of being dry, it turned out moist and delicious. I used a bundt pan and was nervous about the amount of sugar in the pan, but it made a delicious crust on the cake.

This is a great pound cake to make any time of the year. It comes out perfectly every time I make it. At the end of blueberry season I make sure I freeze a bunch to use throughout the winter and early spring. Especially to make this pound cake. YUMMY!!

Followed the recipe as is. Delicious! The batter was thick but it was okay to fold in the fresh berries - just be careful not to break too many of them. Baked for 80 minutes and then another 10. Cake was still very moist to the point of being a tad dense but I think it's my oven, not the recipe. I would make again definitely and would add extra vanilla. The kids all loved it.
